Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is black in section, the interior is covered with a brown deposit, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and faint traces of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink, worn in places, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.178)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36408) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36408)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 265 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13454 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
